instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL: What is PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL? This is the voltage coming directly from the charger after going through a transistor. .
definitions.D7012: What is D7012? Diode between ground and gate of Q7010 on 2013-2015 year model macbook airs, necessary for Q7010 to allow PPDCIN_G3H to flow through to PP3V42_G3H power supply input. When this diode dies or corrodes, PP3V42_G3H input will not have any voltage, and chargers will not turn on. This can often be the problem if a system only works with a knockoff charger/bench power supply. .
definitions.Q7180: What is Q7180? Inrush limiter transistor that must be told by the ISL6259 that it is safe to allow charger voltage to pass through to the computer. This needs CHGR_AGATE and CHGR_SGATE to be pulled down in order for it to close and allow voltage through to the system, current sensing failures as well as ISL6259 failures can cause this to happen. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Magsafe not turning on
threads.message:
[B]Board: [/B]<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>

[B]Issue: [/B]Magsafe not turning on. No light on magsafe, putting out about 2v. 

[B]Background: [/B]
Initially came in for no power, liquid damaged around ISL area, as well as <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> area. 

Replaced ISL, cleaned up <SIGNAL>PPDCIN_G3H_ISOL</SIGNAL> area. Unit worked fine. Came back a week later, no signs of life. When plugging in an Original magsafe 2, It puts out the 2v. When I plug in my Magsafe from the DCPS, the unit boots up with no issue.

[B]What I've checked/Done:[/B]
<RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> has the correct measurement of 68k
Trace from <RESISTOR>R7012</RESISTOR> to DCIN connector is okay
Measurement between pin 1 and 6 at the connector are 68k

Replaced DCIN connector, as it had corrosion on the pins.

Not exactly sure where to go next

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Magsafe not turning on
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Magsafe not turning on
threads.message:
If machine boots with lab PSU, or fake charger, then you have leakage issue.
Usually <TRANSISTOR>Q7180</TRANSISTOR>, or <DIODE>D7012</DIODE>.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Magsafe not turning on
